tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: Why, Yahweh, do you stand far off? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?
tn.text: The speaker uses these questions to express his distress that God has not helped him. AT: "Yahweh, it seems as though you are far away from me and you hide from me whenever I am in trouble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"plans"
This refers to wicked people in general. AT: "wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
The noun "desires" can be expressed with the verb "want. "AT: "the things that he wants very much to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
"greedy people"
This refers here to  wicked people in general. AT: "the wicked person" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
A raised face represents pride or arrogance. AT: "has an arrogant attitude" or "is proud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Seeking God represents either 1) asking God for help or 2) thinking about God and obeying him. AT: "he does not ask God for help" or "he does not think about God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: He is secure at all times
tn.text: "He is safe at all times." He is not really safe, but he thinks that he is.

tn.ref: your righteous decrees are too high for him
tn.text: Something that is hard to understand is spoken of as if it were too high to reach. AT: "he cannot understand your righteous decrees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he snorts at all his enemies
tn.text: People snort at their enemies when they think that their enemies are weak and worthless. AT: "he thinks that all his enemies are weak and worthless" or "he sneers at all his enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
This means that he blows air out noisily through his nose.
"The wicked man says"
This probably simply means "forever."
Experiencing adversity is spoken of as meeting it. AT: "I will not have any troubles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: His mouth is full of cursing and deceptive, harmful words
tn.text: What people say is spoken of as being in their mouth. AT: "He always curses people and says things that are deceptive and harmful" or "He always curses people, tells lies, and threatens to harm people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the tongue represents speaking. AT: or "what he says injures and destroys people" or "he speaks words that threaten and hurt people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "he" refers to the wicked man.

tn.ref: his eyes look for some helpless victim
tn.text: The eyes represent him. AT: "he looks for some helpless victim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: He lurks in secret like a lion in the thicket
tn.text: This speaks of the wicked person as if he were a lion. AT: "He hides while he waits for the weak to walk near him, the same way a lion quietly waits in the bush for the animal it wants to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This means to hide or wait with intent to harm or kill.
"lies down waiting" or "he hides and waits"

tn.ref: He catches the oppressed when he pulls in his net
tn.text: The writer speaks of the wicked person catching people as if he were a hunter using a net to catch animals. AT: "He catches the oppressed like a hunter that catches an animal in a net and drags it away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: they fall into his strong nets
tn.text: The writer continues to speak of the wicked person catching people as if he were a hunter, his plans were nets, and the people were animals that fall into his net. AT: "his victims are caught by his plans like animals that fall into a hunter's strong nets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The word "He" refers to the wicked person, and to wicked people in general.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_genericnoun]])
Refusing to pay attention to what people do is spoken of as forgetting. AT: "God does not pay attention" or "God does not care about what I do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Refusing to pay attention to what someone does is spoken of as covering one's face. AT: "God refuses to see what is happening" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he will not bother to look
tn.text: Paying attention to what someone does is spoken of as looking at it. AT: "he will not bother to pay attention" or "he will not care" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Starting to do something is spoken of as getting up. AT: "Do something" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here lifting the hand to hit someone represents punishing him. AT: "Hit him hard" or "Punish the wicked person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Why does the wicked man reject God and say ... "You will not hold me accountable"?
tn.text: The speaker uses this question to show that he is very sad that wicked people do these things. AT: "Wicked people are always rejecting God and saying ... 'You will not hold me accountable.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: You will not hold me accountable
tn.text: "You will not require me to tell you why I do what I do." Holding someone accountable here represents punishing him. AT: "You will not punish me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Break the arm of the wicked and evil man
tn.text: Here "arm" represent power. AT: "Destroy the power of the wicked and evil man" or "Make the wicked and evil man weak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These words have the same meaning. You can use one word to express both concepts. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Make him account for his evil deeds
tn.text: Making someone account for his evil deeds represents punishing him. AT: "Punish him for the evil things he has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the nations are driven out of his land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. "Yahweh forces the people of other nations to leave his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you have heard the needs of the oppressed
tn.text: It is implied that the oppressed people cried out to God. AT: "when oppressed people cried out to you, you listened to them tell you what they need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A strong heart represents courage, and making people's hearts strong represents encouraging them. AT: "you encourage them" or "you make them confident" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: no man ... will cause terror again
tn.text: "no one ... will cause people to be afraid again"
